bibl.title: William L. Tobias v. Territory of Washington. Petition.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
Territory of Washington County of King ss.
In the matter of the application of William L. Tobias for a writ of Habeas Corpus. Petition
To the Hon C H Hanford Judge of the 3rd Judicial Dist of Washington Ter. Holding Term at Seattle.

Your petitioner William L Tobias respectfully shows that he is unlawfully imprisoned, under the name of William J. Tobias that he is unlawfully detained confined and retrained of his liberty by John H McGraw Sheriff of King County Washington Ter. at the County Jail of said Kinh County in the Ter of Washington and that the illegality thereof consists of this to-wit that this your petitioner is not William J Tobias nor is he guilty of any crime whatever.

Wherefore your petitoner pray that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to John H. McGraw the Sheriff of King Co. W. T. cmmanding him to have the body of your petitioner before your honor and Court to doand receive what shall then and there be considered by your honor concerning him and that your petitioner may be restored to his liberty - W. L. Tobias

Sept 29th 1889. Ter of Washington County of King ss.
William L Tobias being duly sworn

deposes and says that he is the petitioner named in the foregoing petition subscribed by him and that he has read the same and that the statements therine made he believes to be true x W. L. Tobias
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 29th Sept 1889 R. M. Hopkins

7255 - $3.00 Territory of Washington vs. William L Tobias
In re application Wm L Tobias for Writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED 28 1889 R M Hopkins Clerk. H. T. Harmon Deputy Clerk.
